website_summaries.verdict: Stands out for its roominess and its top-to-bottom ability to withstand the elements.
pros: Easy assembly and disassembly even in the dark
Roomy enough inside that you can sit up in it and change your clothes
cons: The included footprint doesn't cover the ground in the vestibule
A little on the heavier side

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: lightweight and easy to set up, even in the dark. i tested it in the olympic mountains for a summer, camping over 30 days. it held up very well and kept me dry during several extended downpours. there is just enough room for my 6', 200# body and my smallish pack inside, but i occasionally had to kill hours of time inside while i waited for the rain to stop and was not uncomfortable. i would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. Photo attached.
customer_reviews.text: This tent was absolutely perfect for my four day AT hike across northern NJ. The shelters were full and we all used our tents and all of my colleagues commented on mine. Easy setup, easy access, low weight and price make this tent the one to buy. The rain fly allows for room for your pack to be right at the main access and protected from the environment. I am 6'2" and fit fine inside. It was unusually cold during our hike and the tent protection and insulation from the temps. The design allows you to sit up inside and is roomy enough to change clothes, etc. I am extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: matthew t kemp

customer_reviews.title: This tent is amazing! I can set this tent up in 4 ...
customer_reviews.text: This tent is amazing! I can set this tent up in 4 min by myself, and I don't consider myself especially coordinated! It fits two people comfortably and three people in a pinch. I think my favorite part of the tent is that other than the bathtub bottom, it is completely mesh. I can take the rainfly off and sleep under the stars without all of the bugs. It is also great during dusk when Mosquitos are bad. It is pretty light for the price too. It isn't a backpacking tent, but I have brought it on long trips with no fatigue. Great tent. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Seth S.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: 7 hours in small hail and downpours
customer_reviews.text: Second time using this tent, easy to set up and more than enough room for one large guy and gear or two smaller people. Was battered by pounding rainstorm from the wee hours until 10 AM the next day and the tent was dry as a bone inside! Very pleased with the quality of this tent. Packs small but delivers big when needed! Great for Motorcycle camping!!! This is a honest review, I received no special offers to write this or upload my photos.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent for packpacking
customer_reviews.text: What a great tent. Took it to big bend and backpacked the south rim trail with it during a two night stay on the trail. Perfect size and super easy to setup. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: marcus carrillo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent, puts coleman to shame
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent, puts coleman to shame. The mesh is tougher like some plastic, while the mesh is tighter and doesnt catch on things as much. Because of the seperated rainfly and tent, opening the zippers are quiet. Inside has both the hook and a "tray" hold hold a lantern above. First time setup took less than 10 minutes alone while second time probably about 5 minutes. The tarp (it comes with one!) seems fitted to the tent size and looks like it also attaches to the tent but I haven't used it since im still using my old one. Haven't tried in cold and windy weather yet.
customer_reviews.author: Patatoe

customer_reviews.title: No good in wind
customer_reviews.text: There are so many things that I like about this tent but unfortunately it does not hold up in windy conditions. The tent just collapses in on itself while smacking you in the face with every gust. After the first use, the poles are all bent and wonky. I have had much sturdier tent designs for a lot less in cost. For the positive, the material is high quality and the tent is well ventilated but still pretty waterproof. I like that the rain fly covers the entire tent and that there are 2 entrances and that it came with a foot print.
customer_reviews.author: Eika373

customer_reviews.title: Best value!
customer_reviews.text: With my family complete in size, we needed a 4 person tent for backpacking that would fit us. Two adults and two kids (maybe a dog later). Everyone fits with room to spare. We all use thermarest inflatable mattresess and there is still extra room for packs. Tent is very well made and I would compare it to tents made by MSR or REI. You cant beat the value of this tent!
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: close to perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very easy set up, reasonably light & I love that it comes with footprint! Rain fly is coated and will certainly keep me dry. Super easy to assemble, took me about 5 min to set it up un the living room and I didn't even look at the instructions! mesh will keep the tiny bugs out. No loop on top the hang a lantern but I can figure something out. I am 5'9" and a bit claustrophobic, this totally works for me. I mean I could do without the yellow, bit overall I really like this tent. Can not wait to take this thing hiking!
customer_reviews.author: HIDDEN

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tent. The mesh is very nice and as ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent. The mesh is very nice and as advertised condensation does not collect on the inside overnight. The only negative is that I'm not sure how durable the bottom of the tent is. My last tent had a tarp material for the bottom of the tent which proved to be very durable, this tent has a thinner material. Also, while it is larger than my last tent it is a bit heavier than I would like for backpacking. I may buy the same tent in a smaller size for this purpose. I will say I am very impressed by this tent and I really like the dual entry and the rainfly vestibules.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: The setup is quick and easy.
customer_reviews.text: Fits me and my two dogs perfectly, which given it's a 3 person tent I would expect. Still need to test 2 folks and 2 dogs, but it will probably be alright for that. It's not the lightest on the market. That said, it's not exactly heavy either. I can carry all of it by myself on short trips without a problem. The setup is quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to use and it's quite roomy. I bought this for motorcycle travel so packing size was important. It's not the smallest but it's totally manageable. It is very very easy to set up and it's roomy. I bought the 2 person one to store all the gear inside. It's great for what it is. And if you're in warm weather you can just use the mesh so bugs keep out and there is a ton of air flow.
customer_reviews.author: Aorata

customer_reviews.title: Spacious tent with great airflow, but with a few leaks
customer_reviews.text: We got the 4 person tent and it was really spacious and easy to put up! Our friends were all jealous of the amount of space we had and it even saved us during a rainstorm when we had to cram 6 people at our campsite in the tent. We also loved that this tent was completely mesh, we camped under the stars and had plenty of airflow during the 80 degree nights. Although I do wish that the bathtub floor was a bit higher, we had some issues during the rainstorm where a little bit of water got in between the rain fly and the bathtub floor.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Musquez

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT A COMPACT LIGHTWEIGHT TENT!
customer_reviews.text: Despite what comes up in the search, this tent isn't a compact, ultralight, backpacking tent. It is a nice 2 person tent and will be very good for 2 person camping at a drive in camp ground. IT IS ABSOLUTELY IN NO WAY SHAPE OR FORM an ultralight, compact backpacking tent. It is about as big and heavy as my eureka 4 person tent as far as compaction. DO NOT COUNT ON THIS AS A LIGHT WEIGHT BACKPACKING TENT! I feel a bit stupid for buying it as its weight and packdown is almost identical to a cheap 4 man tent... SKIP THIS!
customer_reviews.author: Infinite-T Digital

customer_reviews.title: Horrible in sandy conditions
customer_reviews.text: The tent held up pretty well to strong winds, but unfortunately it is terrible in southern Utah where there is a lot of sand. The mesh portion is far too low and allowed wind gusts to sandblast me constantly, to the point where I had to pack up the tent in a light mist with 20mph winds. I ended up throwing the tent away due to this.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M.

customer_reviews.title: zippers are NOT one-hand friendly at all
customer_reviews.text: I always get frustrated using this tent trying to get in with a hand full of items in one arm and trying to unzip this door to this tent with the other. have to use my foot to hold down the tent or drop everything in my arm to use 2 arms/hands to unzip the tent. otherwise the tent is good in bad weather when your all settled inside. it is just the coming in and out that is frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Obusek

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but it is not for 3 ppl.
customer_reviews.text: awesome tent! the material is really sturdy. the weight is not the lightest, but it is on the light side. The reflecting stripes are sooo good, so smart! imagine you are in the pitch black night in the wilderness and you can see your tent from far away because of those smart reflecting strips. Every tent should have them.it is marked for 3 persons. which is really not the case. you can barely fit 2 with light pack. if I found a bigger one for really 3 adults with their packs, I would buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Z.

customer_reviews.title: Needed a bigger tent
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tent, it is (relatively) lightweight and compact. We use it for backpacking. It comfortably fits me, my wife and our daughter. Unfortunately, it is a little heavy - a price I pay for the extra space. I love that it comes with a groundcloth, saved me having to cut one out of plastic and keeps everything nice and clean. Overall, good design, easy to assemble and quite versatile. We sleep with the vestibules open during the summer to allow air circulation.
customer_reviews.author: FANLig

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about this tent. When I got it I set it up. It sets up extremely quickly which was great! Unfortunately after the second you said decided to wash The floor on the inside of the tent. I went on to Tetons website and followed their instructions completely. The floor my tent started to disintegrate just from washing using only water no soap extremely disappointed. Hoping it was just a fly in my tent and not all of them. I put in a call to them but had to leave a message. Hoping to hear back soon.
customer_reviews.author: Zachhalstead

customer_reviews.title: Great gear at a great price with even better customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent with lots of room and easy setup/takedown. Excellent price with even better customer service. I've owned this over a year and it's still good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional tent, worth $100 more
customer_reviews.text: I just used this tent for the first time, on a 9 day canoe trip. The wind gusted to 50mph at our first camp at night and rained buckets. But it remained dry inside throughout the storm and held tight in the wind. This was unexpected for a tent in this price range and not a “major” brand. My only recommended improvement is to include better stakes - but this is true for nearly all wilderness tents - especially for the types of alluvial soils found along rivers and lakes. I’m really pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jim K

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This 3 person tent was exactly what I was looking for , it looks nicely made and comes with everything except heavy duty stakes. For the price you can’t really beat the quality of this product. Personally it would be nice to have more color options, darker to more camo colors would attract a larger group of customers to this incredible tent. It’s what I honestly expected from Teton
customer_reviews.author: CheyT

customer_reviews.title: This tent is so easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Three day hike, no leaks no issues . This tent is so easy to set up. I was by myself and had plenty of room for all my gear inside , 65 lb pack. if you are going to use it as a 2 person it will work but you will be using the outside vestibules for your gear unless your both around 150lbs.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Stayed dry through storms and hail
customer_reviews.text: I'm a camping novice and this tent is super easy for me to set up by myself. Last weekend it kept me safe and dry through thunderstorms and hail, and it stayed upright despite the strong winds. The air circulation inside is great thanks to the vents on either side of the top of the rain cover. I also really like being able to have the tent door open and rain cover door closed at the same time; it makes the space outside the tent usable, and I can store things there instead of having them at my feet. Super happy with this tent, and the price is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: I love this tent
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. It is extremely easy to set up and then clean and put away when finished. I've used it twice now in wet weather and it has kept me perfectly dry. I also have ample space to sleep, and keep my pack; but I am only 5'2''.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Menchak

customer_reviews.title: A very reliable and affordable tent!
customer_reviews.text: I just came back from backpacking on Memorial day. I went to Rose Peak in Alameda. The first night there was little bit of rain and winds. The next day got worse with heavy rain and hail. I brought my Teton 2P tent for shelter. My tent made the difference as there was not a single drop of water inside. No condensation at all. Even though the temperature outside was at some point at the thirties, inside the tent the temperature was always comfortable. Besides, I was able to cook my meals at one of the vestibules. My gear and myself were dry at all times. Thank you Teton.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Survived an Insane Hail Storm
customer_reviews.text: I have only taken this on one camping trip so I can't speak to the longevity, but it was certainly tested. It's first camping trip was deep in the Colorado mountains in July. Despite the season the temperature dropped to 40 degrees and golf ball size hail pounding the tent for 1.5 hours. The hail was about 10 inches thick on the ground. The tent was dry, we were warm, and not a single hole. My friends were soaking wet in two different tents. For the money this was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Hill

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I have been searching for a great, reasonably priced tent, for quite some time. I can not say enough great things about this tent. We stay dry and it's a great quality product. We have had no issues and I always recommend it to anyone I know looking for a tent. The 3 person size gives us plenty of sleeping room along with storage for bags and camp gear. Its lightweight and compact when broken down which allows for ease of use when having to hike to a campsite.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Stefchak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: Teton Sports is always my first stop for new camping and hiking gear. This tent looks great, easy to set up, and has plenty of room for me, my husband, our two 50 pound dogs, and a little bit of gear. The poles connect to the tent by hooks rather than a sleeve and that is one of my favorite things about it. I hate pole sleeves!
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Rain/Wind Tested. Performed Masterfully.
customer_reviews.text: Took this tent on a six-day canoe trip. Unfortunately it poured ass rain for five of the six days. Fortunately I had this tent. The weather for five days was a mix of sleet and rain and 15-20 mph wind. And held up masterfully. No water in tent. It handled the wind great. Lots of airflow. The footprint made everything easier. Vestibules are roomy. I highly recommend this tent. This is a review for the two-man .
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Tent is very easy to set up and take down
customer_reviews.text: Used the one man size on a recent trip. Plenty of room for a tall guy (6 foot 4 inches) and a full size thermarest. Just enough room along the side for a bit of gear (headlamp, book, clothes, etc.) Stood up well to wind, and on the last night, it rained at least two inches and I stayed completely dry. Tent is very easy to set up and take down, and the vestibule is big enough for a pack. After the rain, I noticed that I needed to seal the fly zipper and the stake out points on the tent, but the seam taping on the rest of the tent was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ja16351

customer_reviews.title: returned it
customer_reviews.text: It was damaged when it arrived, but honestly it was just WAY too flimsy to even be called a tent. This is more like a bug screen for hanging around outdoors. I couldn't see it lasting very long at all as an actual tent for camping in the summer; the concept is awesome but there is a long way to go before these are ready for practical camping use... IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Aa. in NorCal

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this was a very good buy, I really liked the floor it kept the rain out for 3 nights & 1 frozen night. Other tents around me had water in them & people were wet but i never was as long as the fly was properly set up. I spent a week in it while doing Cycle Oregon & glad i got it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B.

customer_reviews.title: Best tent for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for the money. Features normally found on tents several times the price like sealed seams and an included footprint. Not ultralight but light enough for bikepacking or hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thank You Teton!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a camping trip in Baja and primarily for any camping where I don't have to backpack with it. The quality and engineering seems pretty solid, I was stoked to have a footprint that is meant for the tent and not some odd sized blue tarp that would have been the alternative. I love what TETON is doing!
customer_reviews.author: Jarritos

customer_reviews.title: I love this tent
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. It’s been with me through Death Valley and Joshua Tree and more now. Pros: easy set up, easy to fit in bag, not too heavy for backpacking. Cons: the bath at the bottom was not high enough to keep sand from blowing in a bit in Death Valley (it was very windy) It did withstand the winds quite well. But remember to stake it down for windy places!
customer_reviews.author: Thu

customer_reviews.title: GREAT tent!
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY got a chance to get out camping this year. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE my Teton Ultra 3. Got some light rain over two days and nary a leak. Goes up and packs down quickly; great air flow with the rain fly pulled back; large enough for me, a large, twin air mattress, camp chair, and all my other gear with room to spare, yet small and compact when stored. Pictures show outside view and views from inside looking out. LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: Lawry

customer_reviews.title: Not well thought out for rainy trips
customer_reviews.text: This has generally been a good and reliable product for me, but I take issue with it's performance in the rain. Specifically, the interaction between the vestibule flap and the tent door. When the vestibule is unzipped, the internal mesh door is half uncovered and exposed to the rain. Also, if there is water on the vestibule door and you unzip it without shaking the water off, you risk dumping all that water onto the mesh door and subsequently onto your gear inside the tent. This is an issue that can be managed, but I don't like it, especially for trips to the restroom during the night when it's raining.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Murphy

customer_reviews.title: ... and in Utah while camping/backpacking and it is a wonderful product. I did decide on the 2-man vs ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tent in Idaho and in Utah while camping/backpacking and it is a wonderful product. I did decide on the 2-man vs 1-man to use it for just myself as I wanted to have enough room to move around a bit and have some of my gear inside with me and I'm glad I did. It was easy to set up and take down and really weighs hardly anything. Definitely a great product.
customer_reviews.author: misterjohnlove

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Great tent . I use it when camping at my local dropzone. (Skydiver here) its been rained on and survived 30 + mph winds on the ground. I have yet to use it on a normal camping trip but from what i have seen it doesnt let bugs in and has a good rainproof/wind cover. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: My favorite tent
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and well built. Excellent value. Recently went camping with some friends who got $30 Walmart tents. It rained.. I stayed dry, they were not so lucky. Prime example of you get what you pay for. Also really love there are doors on both sides. Zippers are of great quality.
customer_reviews.author: jlu

customer_reviews.title: Superior product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge! I love it! I love the inside pockets that keep belongings off the ground! This is the nicest tent I've bought so far! Well made!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Counts

customer_reviews.title: Quality family tent but packs large
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, quality tent for my wife, 2 kids, and I. The base width is perfect to fit all of our sleeping pads. The only downside I can see so far, keep in mind we’ve only pitched it and slept in it in our living room a few times so far, is that it doesn’t pack very small. Even with the poles going on the outside of my bag it takes up about a third to a half of my 60L bag. All things considered, it’s still the best I could find and we are happy with it for now.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: 2 adults and a big goofy dog
customer_reviews.text: Very well built, compact and easy to put up and take down. Easily fit myself and hubby and big goofy 110 lb. dog. It rained our first night out and rainfly and footprint worked nicely but it does not have a true bathtub bottom, so the edges got a little wet on the non door sides. It was roomy enough that this was not a problem though, we just moved in a smidge. All in all, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cris F.

customer_reviews.title: Pole tend broke after 2 days
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe is a happen the tent pole just broke after 2 days on the beach. was a bit windy but not that strong to broke a tend. I bought this tend a week ago and now I’m in Colombia whit no way how to change the part or be 100% refound. I felt really bed about I will try to fix in some way before to continue my trip but now I don’t feel anymore 100% safe to do many consecutive day free camping. I’m sorry but for me is 1 star
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: My partner and I usually camped in a two person backpacking tent so when we adopted two 50 lb. dogs we needed a bigger tent. I was so used to the ease of setting up the backpacking tent that I knew I wanted something just as quick and simple to set up. I was so happy to find this tent and after a year of frequent camping trips I can say I would absolutely buy it again. We've only used it for car camping so I can't speak to it being well suited for backpacking, although it is so much simpler than any 4 person tent I've used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Genbob

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: We own several Teton products and have been impressed by all of them, this tent included. The base is rectangular, unlike some tent bases which are trapezoids, so you have some additional considerations when looking at roll mats. Even with one person, the tent is an easy up and down in about five minutes if you had to hurry. I liked the two door, two vestibule design, the included gear loft as well as dropcloth. The last two of which you are usually having to buy separately. It was backpacking friendly too.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Quality tent
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful tent. Easy to setup. Love the orange poles. Wife and I enjoyed keeping it open (no rain fly) for a little bit because it is 90% screen and then it was easy throwing on the rain fly for privacy and rain. Did a solid job in the rain. Also provides a nice atrium for shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Prentice

customer_reviews.title: Great Multipurpose Tent
customer_reviews.text: I recently used this tent in CO on a 4 day 3 night backpacking trip. The tent out of the box weights about 7lbs. but I replaces the stakes and footprint with alternatives to lighten the load down to just under 6lbs. The tent was our safety in a hail storm and the vestibules were large and stayed dry. I highly recommend this tent for non-ultralight backpacking, and car camping. Loads of room for 2 adults. Dries out quickly and is easy to pack and set up. Looking forward to using it on my next camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Sets up fairly easy, roomy inside
customer_reviews.text: Sets up fairly easy, roomy inside, plenty of space for 3 large adults with gear. Would be tight for 4 adults with gear.
customer_reviews.author: Walt42

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you dry and warm.
customer_reviews.text: It rained pretty steadily 2 of the 3 nights we were at the campground and we stayed perfectly dry. The tent when staked out correctly has plenty of ventilation so there was minimal condensation, but it still kept us nice and warm we didn't turn on our portable heater once and we stayed in a mountain region in early March when the night temperatures were still going down to the mid to high 30's.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie💕

customer_reviews.title: Durable tent
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best tents around. Pros: 100% waterproof. I am one of those hikers that always ends up in a storm and it has held up so far. Very durable rainfly. It's a free-standing tent. Vents really well. Cons: A little heavy but take my advice and replace the groundsheet, stakes, and line for some ultralight ones and can get it a lot lighter!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua McGlothlin

customer_reviews.title: Great all around tent
customer_reviews.text: This really is a good tent. I really like the double doors. The rain fly is easy to setup. Zippers are good and easy to use. Plenty of room for 2 people, surprised by extra space. I rated 4 stars because it is on the heavy side for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the best tent I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is relatively easy/fast to setup and may be the best tent I've ever had. I haven't storm tested it yet, but I have no difficulty with the concept. This 2-man tent gets backpacked for use by one person, leaving lots of room for my gear inside.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Riebs

customer_reviews.title: A large 3 man tent.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it's a nice tent. It's really bigger than most 3 man backpacking tents. On one side space is nice, but on the other, they could have saved weight and space by making the foot print smaller. 4 average sized people could sleep in this tent. Seems are taped. That is nice. Lots of storage spots.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dillingham

customer_reviews.title: Great tent. 2 adults fit with room
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. 2 adults fit with room. My 11 year old son can put this up with no problem for his Scouting trips.
customer_reviews.author: Erinito

customer_reviews.title: Good summer off the trunk tent.🇺🇸
customer_reviews.text: All in all, the TETON tent in a good summer tent. If you are not planning in attaching or carrying it in your back pack, but instead just pulling it out of your trunk, this is a great tent. Very breathable and it does not accumulate humidity during the night. I wouldn't recommend it if you plan in camping in cold weather, due to it's inability to keep warmth inside.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Super tent, use the rainfly string stakes also
customer_reviews.text: I set this baby up in 15 minutes my first time out. Excellent tent and my first test run was in 41o weather. The condensation dripped on me a little but I didn't notice it. This would not have happened if I properly set up the rainfly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 4 person tent for backpacking and family camping. Fits 4 adults fine. When broken down, it is a larger than I was hoping. Still should work for backpacking, but considering getting 1 or 2 person tents for each of us.
customer_reviews.author: g l

customer_reviews.title: Teton Mountain Ultra 3
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it yet as I just got it. I did set it up in about 8 minutes without directions and it was so simple. I’m really liking this tent and can’t wait for spring to use it. Quality is top notch but that’s what I expect from Teton. This 3 man tent offers plenty of room for 2 and gear.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff’s Outdoors Adventures

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and simple!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this tent! Setting it up was a breeze, took me about 15 min only glancing at the instructions once or twice. It has plenty of room for my husband and I with our gear and 80lb lab. I especially like how the two entryways are set up at the head/feet so we won't be crawling over each other to get in or out.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up / tear down!
customer_reviews.text: Setup and teardown is a breeze! My tent was up and I was relaxing while everyone else was wrestling with their tents. It rained the first night and I was completely dry. A great product, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Stay dry inside this tent!
customer_reviews.text: My son who is 13 has had this tent for a little over a year and takes it with him on boy scout campouts. It is a good tent for hiking trips since it is compact and light. He just came back from a trip that rained all night. He said he always stays dry in this tent. He really likes it. He is 68.5 in. He has room for him and his pack inside the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Mange

customer_reviews.title: Backpacking Done Right
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. I have used it for many trips, and will continue to use it for future endeavors.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, coffin like tent.
customer_reviews.text: So small you have to sleep with your arms crossed. No room for gear, except perhaps a thin water bottle?
customer_reviews.author: Blueman

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6ft and this was perfect for me, my dog, and my backpack. Setup was super simple and can be done alone. Also got caught in a thunderstorm and stayed perfectly dry. It's hard to get everything back in the bag nicely but that's my only complaint so far.
customer_reviews.author: Never Mind

customer_reviews.title: Sweet tent.
customer_reviews.text: The tent is a cool design, doors on both sides are great. I've used this tent 3 times and the stitching around the zipper is starting to come undone. Update to my review, customer service got back to me right away after a replacement tent was sent and I had another issue. They were all over it and sent me new poles for the one that was broke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Tent Rain or Shine
customer_reviews.text: This tent held up wonderfully in a heavy rain storm with 90% of the inside of tent staying dry. I had a few items touching the edge of the tent that got wet but other wise me and my 3 young children were nice and dry inside. In warmer weather it was great to be able to take the "top" off or pull it back half way and let the air flow through the tent. Also nice to be able to open fully to enjoy a starry night without the bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Rees

customer_reviews.title: Just what i needed
customer_reviews.text: This tent seems a bit heavier than what is says it is but for only 100 I'm good with it. The tent parts all come in bags, the poles, stakes, footprint, tent... you could lose a little bit of weight by forgoing the separate bags. When on a budget this tent is amazing. It's super easy to put up, great room for a 1 man inside, good height for sitting up or kneeling. Everything seemed to be sewn perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S

customer_reviews.title: Good deal of rain and this tent was perfectly dry
customer_reviews.text: Just wrapped up a campout. Good deal of rain and this tent was perfectly dry. Very easy to setup/take down. Looking forward to many more events with this.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Bentrup

customer_reviews.title: Versatile & compact
customer_reviews.text: Just took this tent on a camping trip in Utah, Colorado, and Arizona and are so pleased with the product! It was comfortable and allows for adjustments to different types of weather. The mesh portion was perfect for star gazing and hot nights and the rain fly was perfect for our more windy and cold nights. Simple set up and compact tent for backpacking, definitely reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Kassie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent. Fits me well as a smaller size ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent. Fits me well as a smaller size person. Easy and quick to put up, and keeps me dry.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Allison

customer_reviews.title: Build quality seems good so far
customer_reviews.text: Had it up and together within 15 minutes. There is no way you're fitting 3 people in this thing. Build quality seems good so far. Happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent as a backup to my camping hammock. I’m glad I did since my hammock broke when I went to set it up. I experienced a really bad rain storm with hail when I was camping. I stayed completely dry. Set up of the tent is extremely easy. The rain fly is a little harder. This tent easily fits in a small dry bag which was great for kayaking.
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, and 2 small shortcomings...
customer_reviews.text: Great Tent! All the needed items came with it and the quality was amazing throughout the stuff sacks, tent pegs, taped seams and fit and finish... The only 2 "shortcomings" is a needed loop or way to hang a flashlight from the sewn in shelf in the mesh roof and the included ground cloth was too "small" to line up with the outside footprint of the tent body itself... But overall... a 9 out of 10!
customer_reviews.author: Eagle Scout Class of 1972

customer_reviews.title: A bit different than expected, but a good different
customer_reviews.text: Set up in the front of the house this morning. Was surprised the interior tent portion is all screen, so for privacy you must have the fly installed. On the flip side, in the hot months, no use the fly and would be tons cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd L. Lipska

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Little Tent
customer_reviews.text: Folding the tent back into its small bag is something I expect to be difficult, and was pleasantly surprised when it was very easy to break down camp and fold the tent neatly back in its bag. Construction is sturdy, it is well built, easy to erect even with my limited camping abilities. Took it on a flying camping trip and it just performed flawlessly...
customer_reviews.author: Peter Kalev

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to assemble, great value
customer_reviews.text: Owned a pair of these tents for over a year now: one for me & one for my 13 yr old son. Used on at least 6 separate campouts so far (primarily Boy Scout outings, 2-3 days at a time), and they are holding up very well. Easy to pitch and break down. Decent for/2 people, awesome for single occupant. Although not an 4-season tent, I used mine during a Winter Camporee & was fine w/the right bag and sleeping pad. An all around great tent.
customer_reviews.author: DWJr.

customer_reviews.title: A good, complete tent.
customer_reviews.text: I used this tent as a one-person tent for a week of canoe wilderness camping. It is easy to set up, even in the dark. I appreciated getting the footprint included with it. As I was canoeing I brought a tarp as extra rain protection; in a downpour the vestibule would not have provided a lot of coverage. The tent held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Jean J.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, perfect for solo camping
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality, design. Easy to assemble after reading instructions. Well-made, seems to hold up well. Comes with fly and tarp, very nice to have it all.
customer_reviews.author: Khang K Tran

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: First weekend camping with this tent we were in a torrential downpour. Stayed very dry and comfortable. Was very easy to put up and tear down.
customer_reviews.author: bb_um95

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used it outside yet but love it already. I was missing my footprint and reached reached out to Teton directly. They quickly shipped me one hassle free. They have excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Camped with this once, kept me dry and warm. Folds up small and light. Easy to set up. Breathed well, no condensation inside.
customer_reviews.author: marpcnm

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice tent but I don't see how you could get ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice tent but I don't see how you could get four people in the four person tent, we just fit three. Also it is a little heavier than I would like for a backpacking tent.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L

customer_reviews.title: Big!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the style and material was impressive. The Floor & footprint are made out of heavier material than I've seen on other tents. This likely adds a little bit extra to the weight. We bought the 3 man tent, but as long as you are under 6 ft tall, you can easily fit four adults. I took my kids camping, and there were four kids plus myself with still room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Codi White

customer_reviews.title: Solid 2 person tent
customer_reviews.text: Solid tent, easy set up and take down. We had plenty of room for two people while leaving backpacks in vestibule. It is somewhat bulky for backpacking if you roll everything up in a single bundle. I personally put the stakes and footprint in with the poles, and roll up the tent and rainfly separately . Maximized pack space this way.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great tent.  Not above average, great
customer_reviews.text: Great tent and service from Teton customer service is even better than their tent.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Qualls

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It sets up quick, I bought the 3 person tent and it's just right for me and my things tall enough that you don't feel cramped, didn't back pack with it used it out of the truck, meaning that I hauled it around in the truck and set it up on the ground at night
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Headphone

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Colorado
customer_reviews.text: Great brand and this tent is just one more example. Can’t wait to really put it to the test
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Set up and take down of tent very easy. Slept one night in tent to try out
customer_reviews.text: Set up and take down of tent very easy. Slept one night in tent to try out, I am 5'4' was roomy enough for me, bought for backpacking price was good and it was less than 5 lbs, could get rid of extra bags and stakes and make it lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my son for his birthday and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Sapper14

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tent!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking tent, looks durable and well made. Has nice pockets to hold personal belongings hang lights inside the tent.
customer_reviews.author: scarlettsan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and light.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected! Going to the Amazon for work, and we will hike some parts. Perfect for sleeping in an indigenous n community. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Mey-Verme

customer_reviews.title: lashing straps
customer_reviews.text: carry case straps failed on first 24 hours of use. otherwise fully functional
customer_reviews.author: BSEE

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tent with easy set up and practical features
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tent with easy set up and practical features. Good for 1 or 2 people for short backpacking or car camping outings. Only used it once so far, so can't comment on durability.
customer_reviews.author: Reece C. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Great tent at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tenet last year and have been very happy with it. I am not an avid backpacker and it was my first backpacking trip. The tent was easy to install and repack. Everything fits nicely in the carry bag. It was very roomy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Anbar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Are there better ones, sure but for the price point it is really a great tent no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Derr

customer_reviews.title: okay but small
customer_reviews.text: wish it were a little larger and a little taller, just doesn't feel like a 4 man tent.......only 2 comfortably. Industry issue
customer_reviews.author: J. Heyer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent. A little on the heavy side for backpacking, but very convenient for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I was a beginner backpacker, and on my first trip, the organizer said I had a good tent. He gave a 5 out of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Ma

product_meta.title: TETON Sports Mountain Ultra Tent; 1-4 Person Backpacking Dome Tent for Camping
product_meta.description: When you’re ready to put in the time and miles to get to the remote and beautiful places outdoors, the right tent can make all the difference. The Mountain Ultra Tent comes in different sizes to fit your needs. Choose a 1, 2, 3, or 4-person tent depending on how many adventurers you’re taking with you. It’s hassle-free so you don’t spend your time wrestling with the setup. Lightweight, waterproof and made for all types of weather with a 360-degree ventilation system for added comfort. The Mountain Ultra Tent is quick to take down when it’s time to head home. It’s camping made easy.
feature_bullets: STAY DRY: Waterproof rainfly with a 360-degree ventilation system for optimal air flow that allows a cool, comfortable night’s sleep; 1 to 4 person camping tents available
ROOM WITH A VIEW: Get away from the city lights and enjoy a full view of the Milky Way; Full dome mesh top allows for an amazing stargazing experience
EASY TO SET UP: Lightweight tent packs down tight for backpacking, hiking and camping; Micro mesh inner tent with perfect fitting, waterproof rainfly
PACKS UP EASILY: When it’s time to head home the Mountain Ultra Tent is a quick, hassle-free take down
TETON SPORTS PROMISE: Reach out to our AMAZING product support team if you have any questions or concerns; YOU CAN COUNT ON US to get you taken care of and back OUTDOORS with TETON Sports

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
